pr_title: [IOTDB-863]: add a switch to drop ouf-of-order data that is recognized by IoTDB

timeline.message: fix loginfo appender ref to FILEINFO

timeline.bodyText: you should move the code to the position before previous two line, because the two line  has no meaning if the data will be discarded.
timeline.author: mychaow

timeline.bodyText: so, the first row of one timepartition always insert into unsequence memtable?
timeline.author: mychaow
samperson1997
qiaojialin

timeline.bodyText: I think you forget to control last batch of data and update cache part. These part also need to filter unsequence data
timeline.author: SilverNarcissus

timeline.bodyText: You may change the time partition range to test some conner case of your code
timeline.author: SilverNarcissus

timeline.bodyText: You should also add some flush operation to test your code
timeline.author: SilverNarcissus

timeline.bodyText:
use this line to change the time partition and add some test over different time partition. IoTDBDescriptor.getInstance().getConfig().setPartitionInterval(100);
do not forget to set it back to original value. You can refer to IoTDBMultiSeriesIT.java for this. Thank you very much XD
timeline.author: SilverNarcissus

replies.bodyText: Thank you for your review! I added test cases for time partition = 100, 500 and 1000.
replies.author: haimeiguo
